title.narrative: AIP-Emerging Infectious Diseases for Human Health

description.narrative: The Australia-Indonesia Partnership for Emerging Infectious Diseases (AIP-EID) Human Health Program will be delivered by The World Health Organisation (WHO) Indonesia in close collaboration with the Ministry of health (MOH) and sub-national agencies. Program outcomes will be achieved through four components: 1) Expanding and Strengthening the Early Warning Alert and Response System (EWARS); 2) Strengthening and Ensuring Sustainability of the Outbreak Command Post; 3) Enhancing the quality and sustainability of the Field Epidemiology Training Program; and 4) Strengthening of capacity in the area of zoonosis risk reduction, risk assessment and risk communication and epidemic response. The activities under these components build on work supported by Australia to date and are critical elements of Indonesia's EID management system. Another component serves to provide emergency support to the MOH to respond to EID outbreaks. Expected outcomes include: The MOH will have an increased number of
